direction.raw_text: Did Grace try to ride, Joe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I expect you should talk to Grace about that, ma'am. And if I did anything wrong, then I am sorry. Ever the gentlemen, Joe exits. Annie looks to Tom. He's about to leave, when he stops and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let her turn you away. Tom exits. Annie stands and faces Grace's closed door. Slowly, she lowers herself to her knees and sits on them, thinking... reminiscent of Tom, waiting for his moment with Pilgrim, in the field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know how long Annie waited, but she knocks gently, then enters to find Grace, in her nightgown, on her bed, with the night stand light on. Her prosthesis is against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace? Is everything all right? (no answer) Can we talk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... (nervous) So you tried riding again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Does that mean I'm cured?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, nobody's trying to cure you -- GRACE ... You worried everything all right now and we'll have to go home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You... not wanting to go home because you hate daddy so much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace, I don't hate your father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't remember the last time you made him dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just trying to say thank you to Diane and Frank and -- GRACE Tom? Annie sits by the bed, Grace moves away a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I just wanted to say, I think it's great you're riding again. And... and I think I know why you, you needed to do it alone... without anyone knowing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, you know everything!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Why can't I talk to you!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Stop pretending like you care! Like this really isn't about you and Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ?! How can you -- (at a loss) I'm sorry if my friendship with Tom bothers you so much, but I happen to value having someone to talk to, especially when my own daughter ignores me night and day because no matter what I say, it's wrong and no matter what I do, it's wrong... I'm sorry I'm such a disappointment to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, now you know what it feels like. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't deserve that. I have never looked at you as a disappointment. If I'm on your back to do better, if I push you to try harder it's because I want you to be the best you can be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Because I'm your daughter which means you're the best mother! Isn't that what you're always talking about in interviews -- having it all, the great career, the great family... Proving everybody wrong. Wanting everybody to think you're this perfect woman! Beat. They're both exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, if... if there's a part of you as parent that... that takes pride in your child -- that, you can look at them and see something you've accomplished as well... if that's wrong, then I'm sorry. (no answer) But it wasn't my intention. I don't push for me. I do it for you... So you don't waste half your life feeling like you don't know where you belong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, you've done a great job. Beat. Annie feels deeply hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, then I do apologize... But what I'm most sorry for is turning you into a spoiled brat who can only think about what she's feeling... who can't admit when she's wrong and who can't forgive when she's not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! Annie stops to exit as Grace says something under her breath. Annie stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said... I started. Grace starts to sob. Annie doesn't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Started what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My period.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When? Tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I felt it happen downstairs and when I went into the bathroom. Annie reaches down to touch Grace's shoulder. Grace turns -- there is no anger in her face. Annie sits and takes her in her arms. Grace clings to her and sobs like a little girl. Annie sees tears run -- gratefully, lovingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's going to want me now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?... Oh baby...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's ever going to want me? Nobody will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you are... one of the most... incredible, bravest, most beautiful woman I have ever met. The efforts you make. Your courage and your dignity. (laughs thru tears) I don't know where you got it? I honestly don't know how I would have handled all this if I were you. Grace is so grateful, they cling to each other even harder. As the tears subside, Grace manages to admit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry... about what I said. It's just that -- all those times you and Daddy were trying for another kid, I... I used to pray at night that it would work. And not because of you guys or that I wanted a brother or sister... but... just so I wouldn't have to be...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So special. Because I was the only one. You both wanted me to be so good at everything, so perfect and I wasn't. I was just me. And now I've completely ruined everything, anyway... They both start crying again as Annie rocks her gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sshhh... Ssshhhh... They hold each other as if for dear life...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S to discover mother and daughter, fast asleep, in each other's arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom sits alone, writing at his desk. His music is playing. He stops to look out the window overlooking the Creek House. Annie and Grace fell asleep with the lights still on in the living room. Tom is thinking of Grace and Annie -- wondering what happened after he left... conflicted by what he feels for Annie... And remembering why they're here in the first place...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The phone rings, awakening Annie first, then Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, this is ATT Conference Service. Is this Annie MacLean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a conference call scheduled for you with Mr. Gottschalk and Mr. Farlow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Oh, yes. One moment, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, nothing. I'm going to pick it up in the other room -- would you hang this up for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Annie moves to the other room, sits down at her office space, takes a breath, then picks up, yelling to Grace;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Grace... (click) Operator?... I'm ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie and Grace are standing by the arena fence. Frank, Joe and the Twins are sitting on the fence rail. Joe is holding a saddle and a bridle, standing in some shadows in an empty arena. Pilgrim comes running into the ring. Out of habit, he starts circling the ring. He sees Tom holding a saddle. Pilgrim walks towards him. Curious, he stops, looking at him. Tom puts the saddle down, sitting crossways on it. Pilgrim walks towards him again. He stops, looking at Tom again. Tom just sits there, playing with the bridle. Pilgrim walks around him. Tom doesn't show him any interest. Pilgrim comes closer. He looks at the saddle. He runs off. He stops, looking back. Tom just sits. Pilgrim walks back over. Tom stands and shows him the bridle. Pilgrim comes closer, sniffing it. He rubs his nose against the leather. Tom pats his head. Then, in one quick, but deft motion, he puts the bridle on him. Pilgrim tosses his head, but it doesn't seem to bother him. Grace and Annie watch intently. Tom takes the reins, walking Pilgrim around the ring. He walks him to the saddle. Pilgrim paws at it with his hoof. He turns and runs off. Tom lets him go. Pilgrim runs around the ring, slows down, looks over at Tom. Tom picks up the saddle. Pilgrim, cautiously, comes back over. Tom, with the saddle, walks away from him. Pilgrim, again curious, follows him. He nudges Tom. Tom stops. Pilgrim comes around to take a good look at the saddle. Tom rubs his back. And gently, like laying down a sheet, puts the saddle on his back. Pilgrim shuffles slightly at the touch. Tom quickly cinches it. Taking up the reins, he walks Pilgrim around the ring again. He starts to jog. Pilgrim jogs with him. And in the middle of the jog, Tom grabs onto the saddle horn, and without breaking his stride, pulls himself back up onto his back. He lays across the saddle, letting Pilgrim feel his weight. He sits up, and without letting him break his stride, he urges Pilgrim with his thighs, keeping him in the jog, riding around the ring. Grace and Annie cheer. Tom tips his hat to them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace is cleaning stalls, etc... She exits one of the stalls with a pail and stops -- looking down the barn to where she knows Pilgrim is. She places the pail down and gathers her courage. She walks to Pilgrim's stall. She stands motionless for some moments before she opens the doors and enters... Pilgrim steps back a bit. He looks at her. He pins his ears back. Stomps his feet. Grace is about to turn and leave, but she stops herself and remains still. Slowly, she reaches out to touch Pilgrim's head... and he lets her. We see in Grace a maturity of character, a willingness to face what she must face... the beginning of a compassion, not only for Pilgrim, but perhaps for herself as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A full moon lights the ranch. Tom pulls up to the ranch house in his truck, parks and gets out. As he walks towards the house, he hears: Grace exits the Creek House and coming towards him, a coat over her nightgown. Tom waits until she reaches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was waiting for you to come back. Tom instinctively knows what she wants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hungry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace sits at the table. Tom is cooking at the stove. It feels as if they are the only two people on earth. Grace gets up her nerve... and begins:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judith was telling me about this boy she really liked. She never even had a chance to tell me his name... She starts to quietly cry, but it doesn't stop her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were going to go around by the railroad bridge... And we see the accident all over again... But this time, a movie -- as clear as reality -- but in deathly silence. Just the sound of Grace's voice, and her heartbeat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The horses are going up the icy path...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were laughing about something, I don't remember what. Her horse fell... Judith's horse suddenly stumbles on the ice, going down, throwing Judith, her foot helplessly caught in the stirrup. Her horse sliding back down the hill. Grace tries to move Pilgrim to avoid the errant horse, but it's too late, the horse plows into them, the horses sliding back down the hillside onto the empty COUNTRY ROAD...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - EARLY MORNING Pilgrim is first to find his legs. Judith's horse, its leg broken at the ankle, walks in a confused state. Judith's foot is helplessly caught in the stirrup...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Judith's foot was caught in the stirrup... she couldn't get up, she was so scared... (cries) I saw this truck, coming around the turn... She sees the glint of the steel. The Truck suddenly appears from around the bend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...He was honking, trying to get us to move... I tried to grab the reins to get Judith's horse out of the way... Grace grabs the reins of Judith's horse. The horses are spooking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...And the truck started skidding... The truck skidded on the icy road, going out of control, jack- knifing, heading right for them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...It was coming right at us... There wasn't any time to do anything... It ran right into Judith's horse... The truck bed plows into Judith's horse...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Judith just disappeared... And it came right at Pilgrim and me... We see this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...And Pilgrim reared up at the truck and I fell off... Grace falls onto the road, the truck running over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace sobs uncontrollably now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judith... Oh God, Judith. I'm sorry... Tom is near and holds her as she puts her head on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't tell you it'll stop feeling this bad... But I can tell you, you didn't do anything wrong... The same thing would have happened to me... or Frank... or Joe... And there's no sense in looking for a reason why things happen... (self-reflective) I used to try and... always came up short. I don't think the why so's important as... what we do with what we get. I remember this boy I'd see up on the Blackfeet Reservation. He was sixteen. Great kid. Strong. He'd gone swimming and dived headfirst into a rock. Snapped his neck, paralyzed him... After the accident, I'd look in on him from time to time... and he wasn't there anymore. His mind, his spirit, whatever you want to call it, it just disappeared. And what was left was nothing but anger... It's like the boy I knew just went away somewhere...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know where he goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you do. Don't you disappear. (holds her tighter) You do whatever you have to, to hold on... (thinks) I'll tell you one more thing... When Pilgrim reared up to face that truck... you know what I think?... I think that damn horse loved you so much, he was trying to protect you... That's what I think. Grace listens to this. As Tom holds her in silence, it's almost as if they were father and daughter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom stands with Grace in the corral. Tom's horse, Rimrock, is saddled nearby. Tom takes Grace's cane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me hold that... Grace stands, looking at the horse...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't... not yet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no hurry. Take you time. She's trying so hard to be brave. After a moment, she reaches for the saddle horn. She puts her prosthetic leg in the stirrup, takes a breath and swings her leg up -- slipping, falling to the ground. Tom doesn't say anything. She pulls herself back up. She repeats the action... determinedly. She swings her leg over again and sits squarely on the horse. Tom remains still, but proud. As the day breaks, we leave them in silence -- Tom standing, hands in pocket... Grace sitting up on the horse, proudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Endless sky. Annie is jogging off in the distance when she looks up and stops to see: Tom and Grace, both on horses, stopped on a rolling hill. They do not see her. Annie is filled with emotion... pride for her daughter, gratitude for this amazing man. As the two ride off into the distance we do a slow:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... CATTLE DRIVE...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank and Diane, with the Twins, dogs at their heels, ride in front of the herd. Behind them, Joe riding alongside Grace. Smokey and some Hands ride among the herd, keeping them moving. And riding behind the herd are Annie and Tom...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Highlighting, in particular, those in which the rising sexual tension between Tom and Annie is apparent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cattle stands in silhouette. We hear singing. Everyone is sitting around a campfire. Frank's playing the guitar, singing along with Tom. They laugh when a lyric or a note goes wrong. Everyone is enjoying it. Annie, her arms around her knees, sits off by herself. The song ends and people applaud. Frank hands the guitar to Hank;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Play that sweet one you know. The one makes my wife here so friendly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You! Hank begins to play and sing a painfully pretty song. His sweet voice is stark contrast to his gruff, strongman appearance. Frank offers his hand to Diane, she slaps it away and laughs, he helps her up and they start to dance. As everyone watches... Joe stands and offers his hand to Grace;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't want to dance with me, would you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't thinks you'd want me tripping all over you in front of everybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't let happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you're a good kid. Joe smiles and helps her up. They come together and start dancing. Annie is watching, holding her breath with gratitude. Tom notices Annie off by herself and crosses to her. He extends his hand. She hesitates, looks again to Grace with Joe, then accepts... His hand slide to her back. Her hand to his shoulder. They dance. Their bodies closer than they've ever been. Slowly, she leans her head against his body. And surrenders, for the moment... Diane sees them. She holds her husband fast, and buries her head on his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taking Tom and Annie a bit further in their intimacy; perhaps Tom takes extra special care to explain things to Annie, or fix her saddle cinch, or make her laugh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cows stands in the pasture, grazing. Annie and Diane are cleaning some pots and pans in the stream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must be nice for you to take a few days off from your work, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I have more than a few days, ha, ha... I uh... I'm sort of... not an editor anymore... right now... First time I've said it out loud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They fired you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's more like a leave of- (stops) Ha, ha, ha. Yeah, they fired me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't seem to upset?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delayed shock. Or maybe not. I know I could talk my way back if I wanted or... go to another magazine, someplace... Just not sure if I want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess you don't have to figure it out until you go home. This phrase "go home" stings Annie -- though Diane said it innocently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you always know this was the life you wanted?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fell in love. After that, I never thought about being anything but a rancher's wife. I never saw it like I was losing some other life, just felt like I was gaining one. I know that's not a popular opinion nowadays and I ain't saying it's the right one. We all have to find the life meant for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank's a good man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't come better. But I don't deny there are times I wonder about things I won't have. Maybe one day I'll get to see Egypt. Maybe not. But I know if you try too many different lives, you can wind up with no life at all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like something Tom would say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it does. Annie and Diane resume washing the dishes in silence. Annie deep in thought. Until Diane stops. After a beat, Annie notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie, I'm not good at this kind of talk -- goes round and round a thing but never comes to it -- so let's just say what it is. When you first came here, I didn't like you and I was worried. Tom means a lot to me and this family. Don't go looking here for whatever you looking for. Don't make that man go through something it took him a long time to see his way clear out of the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think anybody can make Tom do anything he didn't want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a good man, Tom is. He's got a gift, come from heaven above, I swear. But he's still a man. And a woman can lead a man into the middle of a mountain lake -- and still make him think he's on dry land. Diane's words ring in Annie's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead in stillness. The cattle dark and motionless. Everyone asleep in bedrolls around the pasture. Annie awakens, looks up at the moon, watching it go in and out of the clouds. She looks over to sleeping Grace... Then looks to where Tom is -- and sees his sleeping bag is empty. Quietly, she rises and looks for him. She starts across the grass and sees him crossing on his haunches, wearing a slicker, sitting in the grass by the stream, drinking some water. She watches him. Tom senses something and turns. For a moment, they just look at each other -- half disbelieving the inevitable is so close at hand. Annie approaches as Tom rises. They meet. They kiss. Tentative at first, but more, just to make that very, precious first moment of discovery last as long as it can. The kiss grows more passionate. They begin to lose themselves in each other. Until, suddenly, aware of their surroundings, they part. No words. Their expressions to each other tell all. Annie separates herself and goes back to her bedroll... Tom stands in the grass, by the stream... the moving water, the night's only sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cattle drive returns. Tom, Annie, Grace, et al... are on their horses, heading back towards the ranch when Grace sees in the distance;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad? Annie looks up and sees:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- ROBERT has come to the ranch. He is waiting for them with his luggage beside a rental car... standing out like an Like The Man In The Gray Flannel Suit in the middle of Wyeth's "Christina's World."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone is being introduced to Robert, as Grace hugs him from the side, never letting go of him. Frank, Diane -- who introduce their kids, then Tom and Robert shake hands...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Mr. Booker, Robert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. It's a pleasure. I'm very grateful for the way you took in my girls here. I bet you were surprised when they just showed up out of nowhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah... Laugh. Awkward silence...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I uh... I can already see a change. (hugging Grace) And I'm very grateful to you. Robert is so sincere -- in that openly, modern, "express your feelings" kind of way. Tom just nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you notice -- no cane?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Amazing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we show him Pilgrim, Tom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, we're gonna show your dad plenty. Why don't you all get settled in and we'll do the tour. Excuse me. As Tom walks away, a nervous Robert feels compelled to say:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you later! Tom just nods and keeps walking. Annie and Robert face each other for a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's bring your bags inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait till you see this -- we have the whole house to ourselves... The MacLean walk to the Creek House.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the distance, we see the pick-up truck parked out in the pasture. Tom is standing with Robert -- in jeans, now -- and Grace, telling Robert about the ranch. Robert has his arms around Grace, asking questions, interested in everything... Grace is loving being with her two favorite men...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace waits in the truck as Tom leads Robert through the cows and cowshit, climbs up and hops over a wood fence. Robert follows suit -- not as gracefully -- and gets a splinter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diane is busy in the kitchen when Annie enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there anything you need? I'm going food-shopping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I am going to go after lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, I'll go -- just give me a list. Annie is determined. She needs to be by herself for a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom continues his tour as the dogs run about them. Tom pays the dogs no attention, except to bark an order. Robert, however, engages with them -- picking up a stick and throws it. A dog returns and gives it back. Robert kneels and begins rubbing the dog's fur, talking to it, looking like an anachronism in his baggy jeans with designer cowboy belt and spanking new designer cowboy boots. Tom waits patiently for Robert, who... and carries on with the dog a bit too long. When Robert gets up, he habitually brushes the dirt off his jeans, maybe even his boots, and makes sure his outfit is hanging properly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace is in the stall with Pilgrim. Once again, close enough to touch him, which he allows. Outside the stall, stand Robert and Tom. Robert squeezes his splinter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe it's the same horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We still have a way to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much longer do you think? Tom understands this man wants his family back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, like I told your wife, it's really up to Pilgrim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone is seated around the table, eating, talking, laughing. Grace is right by her father's side. Frank's in the middle of telling Robert:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We thought we lost him in the snow storm... Told the kids. Had a funeral for the damn thing. Finally, snow stops. Staring to warm up. I go out and start cleaning the truck... Goddamn if that dog doesn't jump out from the back seat covered in snow... I nearly stained myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He thought it was a ghost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dog ghost! Laughter all around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone is outside enjoying the night after a long day. Diane and Annie are on the porch. Diane is showing Annie how she does her needlepoint. Annie is genuinely interested. Tom and Frank and Robert are sitting out front. Grace is at Robert's feet. Joe sits on the ground in front of his father, opposite Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is the poverty worse, now, you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't been back in over twenty years, but I wouldn't be surprised. The population's larger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What were you doing over in India?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, this was right after college. I was in the Peace Corps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That right? Back on Diane and Annie, who hear the laughter O.S. and look. Diane smiles, seeing how much Grace is enjoying her dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sure loves her daddy, huh? Annie smiles and looks herself. Yes, she does, she thinks. Why can't I? Back to the others. Everyone is very interested in Robert's stories... especially Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and I thought before I settled into law school -- everybody knew that was the plan -- I'd take this time for myself. Grace rises to go to the Creek House.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I tell you, Frank, it was one of the -- As Grace passes by, she stumbles a bit and Robert habitually rises to help, but Grace ignores him and rights herself, continuing. Robert quickly sits back down, continuing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... one of the uh... greatest times of my life... I had experiences that, I think, changed my outlook forever. I came back a different person, literally. Tom listens with great interest and respect. Back to Diane and Annie, who watch as Joe follows Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'm going to have my hands full with the son of mine when you leave. Just might be his first broken heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, how sweet. A burst of laughter pulls their attention to the group -- Robert is now standing, acting out a story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and I have no idea what he's saying because I don't understand Hindu... Everyone is listening, with big expectant smiles. Annie watches -- having heard this story before. Her eyes gradually shift to Tom, who is enjoying the story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... So, finally I'm trying to explain to him that I'm allergic to wool and would he please get his sheep out of my car -- Laughter. Robert continues, giving a quick look to Annie -- who is looking at Tom... Robert lets it go, continuing his story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace is asleep. Robert sits by her bed, lit by the moon through a window. He stares at this creature he loves so much. He rises and enters Annie's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tired? Annie shrugs. Robert looks at the bed. He teases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Small bed. Maybe I should sleep in the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're allergic to hay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I apologize for the surprise, but the days only opened yesterday and I figured...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to explain. You have every right to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see why you put your faith in him. He's a genuine... good guy... Good at what he does. That's rare. Annie nods. She tries to hide her discomfort. Robert sits on the bed before her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were right about coming here. I'm sorry for not thinking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's okay. Believe me, there were plenty of times I didn't know what the hell was right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you feeling about work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's not talk about that now. And they're quiet. He moves to kiss her. It's awkward. They look to each other -- as they try to remember how to make love together...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel like I'm on a first date. Annie smiles sympathetically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cars and pick-up trucks haphazardly parked along a dirt road... Smoking open grill barbecues. Ranchers and families move about the ranch, sit and eat at picnic tables with gingham tablecloths... Some teenagers hanging around the corral, talking. Diane and some other women, eating and talking... Frank with a group of men, drinking beer, telling stories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has been set up by the barn. People are dancing under the harvest moon. Grace is dancing with Joe... Tom is dancing with a local woman... Annie with a rancher... Everyone is having a good time... Robert is enjoying a smoke with some men. He looks over to the dance floor and smiles when he sees Grace and Joe. Joe and the Rancher trade place... Joe dances with Annie, the Rancher with Grace... But Tom sees his chance and switches with the Rancher so that he can dance with Grace... She is thrilled and he guides her effortlessly across the floor. Joe and Annie are interrupted by another couple. Joe switches partners, but Annie smiles and excuses herself -- she wants to rest. Robert continues talking with some of the men. He puts out his smoke and looks over to the dance floor. He sees Grace now dancing with Tom... His eyes search for Annie. He moves away from the men until he sees, from a distance; Annie, sitting by herself, amidst the crowd... No one would notice her unless they were looking for her... But Robert does -- and what he sees is Annie looking at Grace and Tom... then, only looking at Tom... Smiling to herself gently... Watching his every move. Suddenly, she rises and exits out of the barn to get some air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie finds an isolated spot, behind the main house, to be by herself and catch her breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom and Grace continue dancing. She's in heaven. Robert approaches and Tom quickly allows him to take over. Grace loves the attention from both men. As they dance off, Tom crosses the dance floor and is met by Hank's wife;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Tom, would you check the shed and see if there's anymore chairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom is walking along when he turns the corner of Hank's house and finds; Annie sitting alone, staring up at the night. They see each other. From behind the house, no one else can see them. It is as if the fates brought them face to face and alone. Without any will to stop it, they embrace and kiss passionately. But when they look into each other's eyes, there is no joy in the kiss. Tom releases her and walks away, heading for the shed. Annie quickly pulls herself together and enters the main house through the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diane is once more sitting at the kitchen table, looking over some bills before bed. Her tape player is on softly. Tom enters and crosses to the sink to get a glass of water. Diane looks up, seeing Tom with his back to her -- standing at the sink, filling his glass -- staring out the window over the sink. She looks to the dish of brownies on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have some brownies left over. Want one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks. Diane senses an uneasiness in Tom. She looks as he drinks his water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -UP ON TOM'S BACK, as if from Diane's POV. But when we pull back we find ourselves;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom is standing in front of Pilgrim's stall. He opens the door. They look at each other. He strokes him and begins to whisper;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something you have to do tomorrow, boy... Camera gently moves away... and Tom whispers to Pilgrim what must be done...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a stillness. A sense of import. Annie, Robert, Frank, Diane, Joe and Smokey, are all at various spots along the fence. Grace stands inside the ring. Tom is standing beside Pilgrim in the middle of the ring. Pilgrim is bridled and saddled. Tom adjusts he stirrup. He walks over to Grace...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All set? Grace swallows hard, nodding. She's worried...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Tom puts his arms around her shoulders and walks out to Pilgrim. The horse pricks up his ears as they approach. Tom motions Grace to stop a short distance from Pilgrim so as not to crowd him. Tom walks over alone, reaching to gently take hold of him. Holding him by the bridle, he puts his head beside Pilgrim's, quietly speaking to him, soothing Pilgrim's neck with his other hand... Annie and Robert are fascinated. Anxious. Pilgrim never takes his eyes off Grace. Tom tries to ease him forward. Pilgrim resists, lifting his head and looking at Grace so you can see the white at the top of his eye. Tom turns him away, walking him in circles, trying to calm him. He leads him back to Grace. Pilgrim tosses his head and stomps his feet. Robert grows more anxious. Annie is calmer, more focused. Tom climbs up on him, riding him around the arena in an easy lope. Grace watches them go round the ring. She looks at her parents and tries to smile. They try as well. Tom dismounts and leads Pilgrim back to Grace. Pilgrim balks again, violently throwing his head, kicking... Grace's shoulders slump, she presses her hands in her pockets, fighting not to cry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smokey... Smokey climbs over the rail into the ring as Tom says something to him. Meanwhile Frank reassures Grace:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll be okay, Grace. Just you hang on there a minute or two. Tom'll get him, okay, you'll see... Smokey jogs over to the gate, climbing it, and disappearing into the barn. Tom crosses to Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's still something going on inside of him I can't reach. So me and Smokey here, we're going to try laying him down. Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's more or less how it sounds. Sometimes it's not pretty to watch. Some horses fight it real hard. Your fella's already shown us he likes a good fight. So if you don't want to watch, I'll call you when it's done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to watch. Smokey re-enters the ring, carrying some rope. He talks briefly to Tom. Pilgrim, sensing something, turns and runs to the far side of the ring. Tom, his arms spread, walks over to him, keeping him by the fence. Tom takes him by the bridle. Smokey comes beside him. Tom unhitches the bridle and in its place slips a rope halter Smokey passes to him. Smokey then hands him two long ropes, one at a time. Tom fastens one under the halter and ties the other to the saddle horn. Tom asks Smokey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got that soft rope? Smokey hands it to him. Tom quietly talks to Pilgrim, runs his hand down Pilgrim's left foreleg and lifts his hoof. Pilgrim slightly shifts. And when he's still, Tom slips the loop at the end of the soft rope over the hoof making sure it's snug. And taking the other end of the rope, he hoists the weight of Pilgrim's raised hoof and ties the rope to the saddle horn. Pilgrim stands on three legs -- an explosion waiting to happen. Tom moves away from Pilgrim, taking the halter line from Smokey. Pilgrim, trying to move, finds he's crippled. Scared, he lurches, hopping on his right foreleg. Seeing he can't walk, panicked, he tries to run. Tom and Smokey, brace themselves, lean back on their ropes and force him around them in a tight circle. He goes around and around like a crazed rocking horse with a broken leg. Tom looks over and sees Annie has left Robert outside the ring to stand by an anguished Grace -- her hands on her shoulders, gripping her. Robert watches, feeling too much a foreigner...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is he doing this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll be OK, Grace. But even Frank isn't so sure. Pilgrim, covered in sweat, still circles. As he runs, his hobbled foot jabs at the air, trying to find peace. He runs and runs as Tom and Smokey lean on the ropes -- until he can't run any more and stops. Tom and Smokey let the lines go slack. Pilgrim, stands there, his wet sides heaving, panting like an asthmatic, making loud rasping sounds. Tom and Smokey speak. Smokey hands him his rope. Turning, he gets a coiled lasso out of the sand. He swings the rope in a wide loop and makes it fall over Pilgrim's saddle horn. He pulls it tight. And he takes the other end of the rope to the far side of the fence and ties it in a quick release knot to the bottom rung. Coming back he takes the other two lines from Tom. Tom crosses to the rail. He starts putting pressure on the rope. Pilgrim feeing it, braces himself. The pressure tilts the saddle hold downward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's trying to get him to go down on his knees... Pilgrim fights. Tom pulls on the rope. Pilgrim, slowly, begrudgingly, gives ground. Tom, brings him to his knees, but it is short lived. Pilgrim is muscling his way back to his feet. Tom pulls him down to his knees again. Pilgrim, fighting with every bit of strength, slowly gets to his feet again. But the pressure Tom is putting on the saddle is too strong and relentless and finally Pilgrim goes down on his knees and stays down. Yet Tom keeps the pressure on... Tom shouts to Smokey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop the lines and come help me... Smokey, dropping the line, runs over. They both pull on the saddle rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough! Stop it! Pilgrim snorts and foams at the mouth, fighting. But slowly, like a wounded bird, she starts giving in. He rolls over on his side and lays his head in the sand and is still. It seems like a total, humiliating surrender. Grace starts to sob, burying her face in Annie's chest. Robert feels impotent to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Tom and Smokey stand over the fallen horse like two big game hunters at the carcass of a kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Will you come here, please! Grace shakes her head "NO." Frank motions to Annie for her to let Grace go... to let stand alone... We see that it's not easy for Annie to trust this, but she does. And she steps back to where Robert stands... Tom, his face set, walks toward Grace...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace, I need you to come with me. Grace violently shakes her head "NO"... Robert gets up the courage to say aloud:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well maybe she shouldn't be here... Annie quickly turns to him and says with quick intensity:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert! Let him handle it! Please! Robert can't watch this. He turns and takes a few steps. Just stops... standing behind and apart from Annie, to just watch... slowly becoming transfixed, like someone who can't stop staring at an accident. Tom reaches Grace and puts his hand tenderly on her shoulder...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace, I need you to come with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you're only going to hurt him some more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not hurt. He's okay. Look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace, Listen... you've got to do this. Just trust me one more time. Grace looks into his eyes and is reminded of all this man has done for her... and she remembers her trust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what? Tom, prouder of her now than ever before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll show you. Tom leads her across the ring, with his arm around her shoulder. Annie tries to maintain her composure. Robert remains still and focused. Tom and Grace come to Pilgrim, lying in the dirt, his breathing plaintive. Tom speaks gently;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to lay down with him. I want you to stroke him. I want to start with his hindquarters and rub him, feel him all over. Grace is shaking her head "NO." He speaks more firmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace, you've got to do what I say. Grace knows there's no way out. She takes a breath and slowly kneels in the dirt beside him, with Tom's help. She lays on him, rubbing him, his hindquarters, his legs, his side, softly rubbing his neck and the wet silky side of his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, listen. I want you to stand on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?! Tom responds to their voice without looking at them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! (they stop) Grace, do what I'm telling you. Stand on him... now! Grace obeys him through her tears. She lets Tom take her hand and guide her up onto the curve of Pilgrim's belly. Then he lets go. Grace stands there with teas steaming down her face -- standing on the animal she loved most in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so cruel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He had the choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What choice!!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either fight the way things are or accept it. Robert, however, is hypnotized by the event. He is having a private epiphany of sorts. Grace sits in the dirt by Pilgrim and strokes him quietly -- she begins talking to him, the way Tom does. Tom watches, as he cautiously steps further away. Pilgrim looks up at Grace out of the dark pool of his one sad eye. They look at each other. And we understand there's a connection once more. A moment of understanding... and forgiveness. Grace starts to untie his ropes. Smokey is about to stop her but Tom shakes "NO"... Pilgrim, like an infant coming out of the water, breathing life for the first time, gets to his feet. Grace and him look to each other. And all is still. Grace grabs the saddle horn. Pilgrim shuffles as if he's going to bolt. Grace quietly reassures him... She then carefully puts her prosthetic leg in the stirrup. Pilgrim shifts slightly. Annie covers her mouth so as not to scream out her fear. Robert breaths heavily. They watch as Grace swings her leg, determined, and pulls herself into the saddle. Sitting on his back, Pilgrim tosses his head and looks as he's going to run off. But Grace puts her arms around his neck, and once again, quietly reassures him. She starts to ride him, slowly, her arms around his neck, talking all the while, around the ring. Annie laughs as she cries -- emotion overwhelming her. Robert feels almost numb with fascination, gratitude, confusion... The slow ride turns into a trot... then a lope... then a canter... round and round the ring. Frank and Diane smile. Diane looks to Tom and knows what he's feeling... Tom watches as any father would -- his heart pounding with pride for the miracle of his child. But he doesn't let on for a second. Grace brings Pilgrim to a stop, lifts her arms to the heavens, victorious. Everyone cheers. Smokey helps her off the horse. She stops to look at Tom, who busies himself with picking up the ropes... So she re-focuses on her parents. They run to each other and embrace... First, she and Annie... then, she and her father... But, as Robert and Grace hold each other and begins to exit, Annie manages to make eye contact with Tom... and tell him with one look, how grateful she is... and how much she loves him. And he receives it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Work on the ranch goes on as usual while Tom and Grace keep nurturing Pilgrim back to life.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: DAY WE FOLLOW THE DAYS AFTER THIS EVENT

direction.raw_text: Grace and Annie go riding...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert takes an isolated hike up the mountain until he comes upon a ridge overlooking an inspiring vista. We can tell Robert is moved by the sight. Sweaty, tired, he find a place to sit... to be still... and to consider his life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank's car is parked up for the trip to the airport that will take the Bookers to Branton, Missouri for Diane's cousin's wedding... Grace, Annie and Robert are outside saying goodbye to the Bookers; Diane, the Twins... and Joe... Joe awkwardly shakes her hand... then removes his hat and puts it on her head. Everyone laughs. They want to hug each other, but don't know if they would... Frank and Tom are packing the car...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Frank, don't forget the wedding present -- it's behind the door in the laundry room. (to Robert and Annie) I got her a pasta maker from the catalogue... Not that they'll know what to do with it in Branton, Missouri... Probably use it as a planter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diane!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank's touchy about his cousins. (they laugh) Well, it was nice to meet you, Mr. MacLean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same here, Mrs. Booker. Thank you again for all your kindness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah... Diane turns to Annie. Robert instinctively steps away, saying goodbye to Joe and the boys... The two women look at each other with respect and concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, are you sure you want to drive that horse back yourself? There are plenty of people 'round here who do that sort of thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I already know the way... and it's not like I have a job I have to rush home for. (Diane nods) Between you and me, I could use the time alone. Diane understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you'll be all right by yourself here, (referring to Robert and Grace) after they've gone? Tom hears this bit of info as he passes by with the wedding present and puts it in the truck. Annie makes sure to avert her look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just one night. If I get uncomfortable, I'll go over to Hanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise. Diane just nods, knowingly. She extends her hand. The women shake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck to you, Annie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You too, Diane. They part. Diane starts giving order as she gets in the car:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, everybody in. Frank, we all set... Camera wides as we hear the voices of departure... see the MacLeans waving... See Tom off by himself, waving... but thinking of something else...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the midst of packing, Annie has made dinner for Grace and Robert. In the midst of eating, Robert asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't we have invited Tom over?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did. He said he had work to do until late. Annie remains silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RANCH HOUSE -- NIGHT Tom exits with a small, leather satchel. He crosses to his truck, tosses in the satchel, gets in and drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace enters the barn to say goodbye to Pilgrim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves to his stall and opens the doors. He stands there, without any fear of her. She smiles and enters. She wraps her arm around his neck, pets him and whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see you home... OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything is being packed up. Robert is dressed for travel. Annie is taping up the boxes containing her computer equipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going to stay in the city or go up to Connecticut?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Connecticut. I told the office I'd work out of there next week. When are you planning to start back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably first thing in the morning. It's too late to start now. I'm going to try not to do too much driving in the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I have a suggestion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take your time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? Annie looks up from the box to see Robert is calmly staring at her. His demeanor is different. Something's going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look like something's wrong. This is Robert's moment. He knows it. He takes a breath and hopes it comes out right:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you something, Annie -- I stood there looking at what was happening to that horse... And, I swear, it felt like the same thing was happening to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understa-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I have two choices. I can either fight the way things are, or accept them. (Annie waits; he smiles) See, I always knew I loved you more. Didn't bother me. I always felt lucky... a little amazed... that such a vibrant, beautiful woman would want to be with a man like me... And I guess I thought as long as I did everything right -- if I was the best husband I could be, the best father... even being a good lawyer only mattered to me because of what it meant for us... if I could do all that, it wouldn't make any difference if we loved each other the same or not... I wasn't asking for more. I told myself I didn't need more. (smiles) But you don't know how you feel about me. You don't know... if you want a life with me anymore... (bravely) And I don't want you to come home until you do know... (the hard part) ... one way or the other. Annie cannot remember a time when she ever loved her husband more than in this moment -- knowing what it took for him to say this. She would not disrespect it with denials. Her throat is choked with tears, she swallows down. She nods. Robert nods, feeling both pride and heartbreak in the same moment. He picks up his bag, kisses her goodbye and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie and Robert walk towards the car to find Grace, leaning against it -- looking depressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter, honey? Gonna miss Pilgrim?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom's gone. Both Robert and Annie are surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smokey told me he left last night to look at some horses in Sheriden. He won't be back for three days. I can't believe he didn't want to say goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... honey... you know... that's just not his way. Maybe you can write him a letter or something. Say thank you... Don't think about it... You take care and I'll see you home. She embraces Grace and, over her shoulder, watches Robert enter the car. Grace follows suit. The car drives off leaving Annie alone at the Double Divide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ranch is still. Annie stands on the porch, her arms folded, vulnerable, looking at the ranch. All her boxes are packed and stacked in the room. She looks over to the Ranch House... to Tom's window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A light goes on. Annie enters, cautiously. She's never been in this room. She crosses to the desk, touches it. She notices a tape player and pushes it on. MUSIC PLAYS... She sees a small framed photo -- of Tom's son, years ago. Suddenly, she feels like an intruder. She shuts the music off and exits...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie faces Pilgrim... she gently lifts her hand and caresses his face. He returns her gentleness. Annie is remembering Robert's words, her heart is heavy with conflict. She jokes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do I get the feeling you know what I should do, but you're not telling me? She hears a truck pull up... Then, a door open and close. Her heart races...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie exits the barn and sees: Tom, walking away from the truck with the headlights left on... is walking right towards her. Annie begins moving towards him, When they meet:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't apologize for this. And I won't hide it. Not for anybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't ask you to. He takes her in his arms and they kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom leads Annie to the front door. She waits as he unlocks it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom leads her to his room. Annie cups his grasp on her with both hands. He opens the door for her, ushers her in, then closes the door. He hangs his hat. She turns to him. They embrace, surrendering to each other's passions.
direction.name: direction

location: RANCH HOUSE, SECOND FLOOR, TOM'S ROOM

direction.raw_text: Camera pas from Tom's window, bright with dawn, past his desk upon which his classical music is playing, over to the two lovers in bed, kissing and embracing. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God, what are we going to do? I'm supposed to -- TOM Ssshhh... (she stops) Stand still, Annie. Takes what we've got, just for now. Can you do that? Beat. She nods. The permission Tom is giving her acts like a great burden being lifted, and for the time being, she surrenders and accepts the gift of what they feel. They kiss.

direction.raw_text: Annie and Tom sit overlooking a breathtaking view. Tom is showing her the rope trick... She looks down at their touching fingers and he gently pulls the rope away, still knotted, and without ever breaking their touch... Annie looks into his eyes, understanding what this means, raises his hand to her mouth and kisses it. She looks up at him with a curious expression;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show me again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One more time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie lays asleep in Tom's arms, under a blanket. He picks up another blanket with his free hand and shimmies it under her head, laying her down. She snuggles with the blanket and keeps sleeping. Tom takes a moment to look at her as she sleeps, gently brushing her hair away from her eyes. He's deeply in love with this woman and wants to keep her with him. But there is a sad resignation in his look. A confusion. He rises and walks to a stream nearby. He bends down to take some water when he hears something. He looks up and sees on the other side:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: giving birth to a foal in the tall grass. And a WHITE STALLION steps in between Tom and the mare, as if protecting her. Tom rises slowly to his feet. Then stands stock still. He and the Stallion penetrate each other. Suddenly this beautiful, powerful Stallion rears -- violently. Tom remains still, but clearly the horse is treating him as an invader... It's as if the Whisperer is now being guided by the Horse towards understanding. As Tom receives it, he remembers;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Summers are short here, Annie. There isn't much of a fall. Before you know it, the roads are closed... the nights get long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I don't care! We'd be together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two people can't just be alone together in the world. At least not us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do this. I can't leave you... Voice-Overs have carried over into a...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WE BEGIN TO FADE OUT ON TOM ANNIE

direction.raw_text: Tom and Annie make love...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't. But there is a difference in their lovemaking. There's a slowness, a reverence... a sense of two people so bounded, that they are outside of time... Their love is so strong it almost feels like despair -- their need to connect has gone beyond their bodies and into their spirits, for which there is no earthly satisfaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun has risen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie awakens in bed and discovers she is alone. She looks around for Tom. She rises and enters the other room to discover: All her boxes and all her luggage have been removed. Her heart sinks. Tom re-enters, fully dressed, to get the last box. He sees on her face a look of confusion and hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figured, whenever you decided to go, you'd be all set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How thoughtful of you. And what if I decide not to go? Tom doesn't know how to respond. He looks away and bends down to reach for the box when Annie commands:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me alone! Beat. They stand awkwardly for a moment, until;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie, please... Tom reaches to embrace her, but Annie attacks him. Punching his chest... pulling at his shirt as Tom tries to put his arms around her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !... NO!... YOU DON'T DECIDE THIS!... NO!... Tom's heart is breaking as he manages to get his arms around her and hold her... as she breaks down and softly, the rage passes... Annie speaks softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know any other way, Annie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Suddenly;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think this is easy for me!? Annie is struck by the powerful sincerity of his words;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just happened this way sometimes. I can't explain it. But I look at you and see Grace and I see Robert, and no matter what you decide about him, I just know this is right. Your life isn't here and you know it. Annie looks into his eyes and asks, softly defiant;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what have we been doing? I mean what was the point?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The point was to love each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? As if there has to be a result... Tom looks at her and says with an almost innocent conviction:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because we had to... And I'll never stop loving you, Annie. Here. Where my life is. The simplicity, and truth, of it hits Annie strongly. Annie releases herself from him and turns away... despondent. Realizing the utter truth and inevitability of what he says. She starts shaking her head. Tom can't hear it... He reaches for her;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie... She turns back into his arms and they kiss passionately... holding each other... as if for the last time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom is escorting Pilgrim into the trailer attached to the Suburban. He looks across the ranch to see the figure of Annie, standing alone, perfectly still, in the pasture, looking out to the horizon... (reminiscent of Tom earlier in the film)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom approaches Annie from behind, stopping a few feet away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie? She doesn't answer... as if she has found her own private place within her, at last... A place of strength. She looks as if she knows what must be done... She hears him about to walk away when she asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we go for one more ride? Tom stops. Considers this. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. I'll saddle them up. He exits. Not seeing the tears in Annie's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom enters the barn slowly. He crosses to Rimrock's stall... then stops. As if he is waiting. As if he knows... Then... he hears the sound of Annie's Suburban starting up. He looks up and knows she's leaving. He waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wide angle of Annie driving away in the Suburban with the trailer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie doesn't look back -- her eyes wet with tears -- but no sobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom lowers his head. It is not his way to say goodbye. And he is moved by Annie's knowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & ROADS ACROSS AMERICA - DAYS & NIGHTS A MONTAGE of images of Annie traveling home... Across different terrains, we see Annie driving -- missing Tom... thinking of what she will decide by the time she gets home. Remembering IMAGES OF TOM:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riding on Rimrock and tipping his hat to her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sitting in the pasture, staring at Pilgrim. Ignoring her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seeing her arrive at the ranch for the very first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie drives, she continues remembering...

direction.raw_text: She and Tom dancing around the camp fire at the cattle drive.

direction.raw_text: She and Tom kissing in secrecy behind Hank's house the night of the barn dance...

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie and Tom coming towards each other that first night after everyone had left the ranch...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom opening the front door to the ranch house...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A much younger Annie waits, surrounded by luggage, as A DOOR OPENS revealing a much younger, more vital, very handsome Robert:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Um, there doesn't seem to be any hotel room available and someone told me to come here and ask for "Tubab" who might to have a place for me to stay. Are you "Tubab"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I am a "tubab."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tubab means white man. Annie is first surprised, then embarrassed but Robert seems so charming and his smile breaks into a laugh, that she just nods and laughs herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over a meal, Robert talks excitedly of his experiences. Annie is captivated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After Annie and Robert have made love, Robert sleeps with his arms wrapped around Annie. She lies awake, feeling safe and loved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie stands where she stood when she and Grace stopped here on their way to Montana... She removes from her pocket the KNOTTED LOOP he made for her, and looks at it.
direction.name: direction
